visualization_prompt: Generate a line chart showing monthly sales comparison between 2023 and 2024 using time-series analysis with categorical month labels
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two 12-dimensional time series representing monthly sales figures. Categorical x-axis labels use month abbreviations while quantitative y-values represent currency amounts. Synthetic data preserves real-world patterns: 2023 series shows summer dip (June-July) and Q4 peak, while 2024 data reverses this pattern with strong H1 performance. The line chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating chart junk while maintaining Cairo's principle of proportional ink. Dual-series comparison uses discriminable colors (#3498db vs #e67e22) meeting WCAG contrast standards. Statistical anchors: 2023 mean=$121.3k (σ=±56.1k), 2024 mean=$127.9k (σ=±58.9k), demonstrating similar variability with inverted temporal patterns.
